Oper is the leading cloud-based digital mortgage software provider, revolutionizing the mortgage experience for borrowers, brokers, and lenders. Our cutting-edge SaaS platform operates across multiple European markets, promoting digital-first distribution and high-touch engagement with homebuyers, from initial contact to contract. Backed by top industry investors and recognized by esteemed fintech accelerators such as Bessemer and Motive Partners, Oper is rapidly expanding. We're on a mission to rewire European home financing and are looking for a Growth Operations Associate to join our team.

Tasks

As a Growth Operations Associate at Oper, you are a high-potential individual looking to kickstart your career in a startup. Your role will cover various aspects of demand generation, sales support, and revenue operations:

  • Demand Gen Support:

  • Coordinate events, distribute and follow up on content campaigns.
  • Collaborate on co-writing content and reports, and create engaging presentation slides.

  • Proactively engage with contacts through email and LinkedIn to set up meetings and drive lead generation.

  • Support for CEO and founders in Sales

  • Support founders in outreach efforts, working closely with them to drive sales initiatives.

  • Assist founders in preparing and post-processing sales meetings, ensuring a smooth and efficient process.

  • Revenue Operations (RevOps):

  • Take over the responsibilities of Revenue Operations, including managing AE activity tracking in HubSpot and pipeline reporting.
  • Collaborate with the VP of Finance & Ops on monthly and quarterly reporting, ensuring a well-coordinated and data-driven approach to revenue operations.

Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in sales, marketing, or customer success roles.
  • Proficiency in French or German, and English.
  • High potential and strong aspiration to excel in sales, marketing, or customer success roles within a startup environment.
  • A proactive and adaptable attitude to thrive in a dynamic setting.
  • Effective team collaboration and communication skills.
  • Strong analytical abilities, using data to inform decision-making.
  • Master’s or MBA degree in a related field preferred.

Benefits

We are a young and fast-growing company with a strong ambition to change an old and slow-changing industry. To achieve this, we’re building a stellar team in which you will be challenged tremendously and where you can learn and grow.

You will work with a high level of autonomy. On top of having the freedom to creatively make an impact, you’ll be surrounded by an open team that is motivated to support you along the way.

We like to laugh, play games & do sports together. In the Oper international team, you’ll be exposed to a close-knit diverse set of minds, you will have a chance to learn new things and share your knowledge, and meet amazing people and cultures.

There is a lot of room for career path development and a lot of opportunities to travel. Moreover, in this role, you’ll be on a path to a Product or Sales & Marketing role going forward.

Our hybrid remote setup with offices in Brussels and Zürich provides us with the flexibility to get together when we want to while catering to every individual lifestyle by successfully working remotely. You can also use a WeWork co-working space if your hometown has one.

Our financial offer will be based on the market standards for the employees in a young (Fin)Tech Company (Michael Page / Glassdoor benchmarked) and will include extralegal benefits based on the legal framework of your location.

Main purposes of the job:

The Technical Account Manager (TAM) will manage the technical relationship with our existing and prospective customers. This is a ‘hands-off’ role, providing advice and guidance to customers on the technical aspects of FinOps. The TAM will provide and assist with the many technical elements of a financially oriented business in the context of cloud FinOps.

Key requirements:
  • Work with our clients to understand their roadmap for future usage.
  • Provide advice for cloud optimisation across both usage (technical) and rate (financial) optimisations.
  • Be able to communicate complex ideas and concepts clearly to customers.
  • Support the sales team with technical, infosec, and service queries.
  • Provide technical expertise and support for existing customers as a Technical Account Manager.
  • Work with our sales team to create the enablement collateral that is needed for the business to succeed.
  • Help the sales team with the technical aspects of closing and onboarding new cloud customers.
  • Assess customer feedback and use your creativity to establish, improve, and refine services.
Key objectives:

The key objectives are as follows:

  • Be the technical expert within the Account Management team.
  • Understanding customer cloud usage roadmaps will aid in improved commitment strategies and drive value for our customers.
  • Answering technical and security-related questions from prospects and customers about our services.
  • Support all aspects of the business in their technical understanding of our service operation, limitations, and opportunities.
  • Understand and sell multi-cloud services to existing customers.
  • Help drive FinOps best practices for our customers through FinOps sessions, reporting, and technical guidance.
Technical/Job Specific skills:
  • Experience using AWS and/or Google Cloud.
  • Associate level credentials are required as a minimum.
  • Professional level credentials are desirable.
  • Experience in Azure cloud is desirable.
  • Strong demonstrable technical background, ideally in cloud or infrastructure services.
  • Wide ranging knowledge of cloud services
  • An understanding of FinOps is desirable
  • A good understanding of Information Security processes
Person specification:

The ideal candidate will be someone with experience working in a quickly changing environment. Someone who excels at creating relationships with key people across varied businesses. As well as someone who wants to work in a position where they can have an impact on the organisation's future. Specifically, the key skills we’re looking for are:

  • Great interpersonal skills, bringing together multiple teams to meet an end goal
  • Strong organisational skills to juggle multiple initiatives at once
  • Ambitious with a desire to learn and grow
  • A technical background or experience working in the cloud is required
  • Experience writing and delivering technical content to a variety of audiences
  • Customer service experience
  • Process-driven with experience defining and enforcing new processes
  • Willingness to travel and attend company events worldwide

Location:

We operate a hybrid working policy that allows employees to work from home or in the office; however, the individual must be able to come to work in the office (London Waterloo) when needed and attend events.

As soon as possible

  • Private medical insurance from day one
  • Benefits scheme, which provides cashback on dental, opticians, massages and physiotherapy from day one
  • Pension benefit scheme
  • Fun company events

We’re looking for a Head of Strategic Finance

🪄 A Bit About Us

AlGooru is a Saudi-based edtech startup that uses AI to connect students with on-demand private tutors over 20+ subjects.

🎯 Main Responsibilities
  • Providing strategic financial leadership to the company
  • Ensuring that the organization has the financial resources and capabilities needed to achieve its goals and succeed in its market

👣 A day in your life

Financial Strategy & Planning:
  • Develop & maintain dynamic business plans & financial models for the company, including expansion plans, new business lines & new revenue stream implementation
  • Drive long-term financial planning & conduct in-depth financial analysis to support decision-making and drive business performance

Fundraising & Investor Relations:
  • Lead the fundraising & due diligence process and identify opportunities for capital raising
  • Developing and executing fundraising strategies, preparing investor presentations, and negotiating with potential investors
  • Conduct financial due diligence for potential investments, acquisitions, and partnerships

Cashflow & Capital Management:
  • Evaluate & manage the company's capital structure, ensuring an optimal mix of debt and equity
  • Optimize cash flow management, manage burn rates, and identify cost-saving opportunities & best cost structure.

Business Performance & Analysis:
  • Monitor key financial performance indicators, identify trends, and provide proactive recommendations to optimize financial performance
  • Provide financial analysis, insights, and recommendations to support strategic decision-making and drive operational efficiencies

Requirements

🏆 Experience needed
  • 4 to 6 years of experience in strategic or corporate finance role with a VC & fundraising background
  • CFA or MBA in Finance/Investment is a major plus. VC or Investment Banking background is preferred
  • Prior experience with due diligence, startup valuations & advanced financial modeling is a must
  • Regional or GCC experience is preferred, with a solid understanding of regional financial regulations and market dynamics
  • Proficiency in paralegal matters that relate to startups
  • Proven abilities to be a strategic thinker (short and long-term)
  • Excellent knowledge in data analysis & Excel/G-Sheets and forecasting models (You and Sheets are in a happily-ever-after relationship)
  • Satisfying comprehension about the world of startups and VCs (investments, SAFEs, term sheets clauses, etc.)
  • Having read Venture Deals and alike books is a nice-to-have
  • 3+ years of experience in managing a team is a nice-to-have

⌛ Our application process
  • Screening & Intro Call (5-10 mins)
  • Chemistry meeting (15-30 minutes)
  • Technical interview (30-60 minutes)
  • Technical assessment
  • Advisor Interview (30-60 minutes)
  • Vision-fit interview (30-60 minutes)
  • Offer extended to successful applicants

Benefits

🎁 Role benefits
  • Work from anywhere
  • Unlimited paid sick days
  • No clocking in/out
  • ESOP shares
  • Laptop fund
  • Fast promotions (like really fast)
  • Enjoy monthly Pizza Fridays
  • Learn anything online and expense it on us
  • Travel for company events and get reimbursed

🎲 How To Gain Extra Gooru Points
  • Demonstrate your entrepreneurial, hustling, and energetic spirit
  • Prove your ability to take full ownership of your role without the need to be micromanaged
  • Conduct proper research about AlGooru prior to your interviews with us, we love people who already know about us

Backed by top industry investors and recognized by esteemed fintech accelerators such as Bessemer and Motive Partners, Oper is rapidly expanding. We're on a mission to rewire European home financing and are looking for a Growth Operations Associate to join our team.

Tasks

As a Growth Operations Associate at Oper, you are a high-potential individual looking to kickstart your career in a startup. Your role will cover various aspects of demand generation, sales support, and revenue operations:

  • Demand Gen Support:

  • Coordinate events, distribute and follow up on content campaigns.
  • Collaborate on co-writing content and reports, and create engaging presentation slides.

  • Proactively engage with contacts through email and LinkedIn to set up meetings and drive lead generation.

  • Support for CEO and founders in Sales

  • Support founders in outreach efforts, working closely with them to drive sales initiatives.

  • Assist founders in preparing and post-processing sales meetings, ensuring a smooth and efficient process.

  • Revenue Operations (RevOps):

  • Take over the responsibilities of Revenue Operations, including managing AE activity tracking in HubSpot and pipeline reporting.
  • Collaborate with the VP of Finance & Ops on monthly and quarterly reporting, ensuring a well-coordinated and data-driven approach to revenue operations.

Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in sales, marketing, or customer success roles.
  • Proficiency in French or German, and English.
  • High potential and strong aspiration to excel in sales, marketing, or customer success roles within a startup environment.
  • A proactive and adaptable attitude to thrive in a dynamic setting.
  • Effective team collaboration and communication skills.
  • Strong analytical abilities, using data to inform decision-making.
  • Master’s or MBA degree in a related field preferred.

Benefits

We are a young and fast-growing company with a strong ambition to change an old and slow-changing industry. To achieve this, we’re building a stellar team in which you will be challenged tremendously and where you can learn and grow.

You will work with a high level of autonomy. On top of having the freedom to creatively make an impact, you’ll be surrounded by an open team that is motivated to support you along the way.

We like to laugh, play games & do sports together. In the Oper international team, you’ll be exposed to a close-knit diverse set of minds, you will have a chance to learn new things and share your knowledge, and meet amazing people and cultures.

Our hybrid remote setup with offices in Brussels and Zürich provides us with the flexibility to get together when we want to while catering to every individual lifestyle by successfully working remotely. You can also use a WeWork co-working space if your hometown has one.

We're on a mission to rewire European home financing and are looking for a Growth Operations Associate to join our team.

Tasks

As a Growth Operations Associate at Oper, you are a high-potential individual looking to kickstart your career in a startup. Your role will cover various aspects of demand generation, sales support, and revenue operations:

  • Demand Gen Support:

  • Coordinate events, distribute and follow up on content campaigns.
  • Collaborate on co-writing content and reports, and create engaging presentation slides.

  • Proactively engage with contacts through email and LinkedIn to set up meetings and drive lead generation.

  • Support for CEO and founders in Sales

  • Support founders in outreach efforts, working closely with them to drive sales initiatives.

  • Assist founders in preparing and post-processing sales meetings, ensuring a smooth and efficient process.

  • Revenue Operations (RevOps):

  • Take over the responsibilities of Revenue Operations, including managing AE activity tracking in HubSpot and pipeline reporting.
  • Collaborate with the VP of Finance & Ops on monthly and quarterly reporting, ensuring a well-coordinated and data-driven approach to revenue operations.

Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in sales, marketing, or customer success roles.
  • Proficiency in French or German, and English.
  • High potential and strong aspiration to excel in sales, marketing, or customer success roles within a startup environment.
  • A proactive and adaptable attitude to thrive in a dynamic setting.
  • Effective team collaboration and communication skills.
  • Strong analytical abilities, using data to inform decision-making.
  • Master’s or MBA degree in a related field preferred.

  • Support for CEO and founders in Sales

Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in sales, marketing, or customer success roles.
  • Proficiency in French or German, and English.
  • High potential and strong aspiration to excel in sales, marketing, or customer success roles within a startup environment.
  • A proactive and adaptable attitude to thrive in a dynamic setting.

AlGooru is a Saudi-based edtech startup that uses AI to connect students with on-demand private tutors over 20+ subjects.

🎯 Main Responsibilities
  • Providing strategic financial leadership to the company
  • Ensuring that the organization has the financial resources and capabilities needed to achieve its goals and succeed in its market

👣 A day in your life

Financial Strategy & Planning:
  • Develop & maintain dynamic business plans & financial models for the company, including expansion plans, new business lines & new revenue stream implementation
  • Drive long-term financial planning & conduct in-depth financial analysis to support decision-making and drive business performance

Fundraising & Investor Relations:
  • Lead the fundraising & due diligence process and identify opportunities for capital raising
  • Developing and executing fundraising strategies, preparing investor presentations, and negotiating with potential investors
  • Conduct financial due diligence for potential investments, acquisitions, and partnerships

Cashflow & Capital Management:
  • Evaluate & manage the company's capital structure, ensuring an optimal mix of debt and equity
  • Optimize cash flow management, manage burn rates, and identify cost-saving opportunities & best cost structure.

Business Performance & Analysis:
  • Monitor key financial performance indicators, identify trends, and provide proactive recommendations to optimize financial performance
  • Provide financial analysis, insights, and recommendations to support strategic decision-making and drive operational efficiencies

Requirements

🏆 Experience needed
  • 4 to 6 years of experience in strategic or corporate finance role with a VC & fundraising background
  • CFA or MBA in Finance/Investment is a major plus. VC or Investment Banking background is preferred
  • Prior experience with due diligence, startup valuations & advanced financial modeling is a must
  • Regional or GCC experience is preferred, with a solid understanding of regional financial regulations and market dynamics
  • Proficiency in paralegal matters that relate to startups
  • Proven abilities to be a strategic thinker (short and long-term)
  • Excellent knowledge in data analysis & Excel/G-Sheets and forecasting models (You and Sheets are in a happily-ever-after relationship)
  • Satisfying comprehension about the world of startups and VCs (investments, SAFEs, term sheets clauses, etc.)
  • Having read Venture Deals and alike books is a nice-to-have
  • 3+ years of experience in managing a team is a nice-to-have
